channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-1564] "NoSuchComponentException: No component with id 'blueprintBundle' could be found"
item.description:
I believe this is an Aries blueprint related problem.
Fairly regularly a unit test leveraging Camel's BlueprintTestSupport fails to create the blueprint context with the general error 

NoSuchComponentException: No component with id 'blueprintBundle' could be found

Full error and stack trace below.
This affects the ability to run Blueprint based unit tests. 

[1]
 
org.apache.camel.FailedToCreateRouteException: Failed to create route timer at: >>> To[log:MyLogger?level=INFO] <<< in route: Route(timer)[[From[timer:myTimer?]] -> [SetBody[constant{Hel... because of No component with id 'blueprintBundle' could be found

	at org.apache.camel.model.RouteDefinition.addRoutes(RouteDefinition.java:177)
 
	at org.apache.camel.impl.DefaultCamelContext.startRoute(DefaultCamelContext.java:778)
 
	at org.apache.camel.impl.DefaultCamelContext.startRouteDefinitions(DefaultCamelContext.java:1955)
 
	at org.apache.camel.impl.DefaultCamelContext.doStartCamel(DefaultCamelContext.java:1705)
 
	at org.apache.camel.impl.DefaultCamelContext.doStart(DefaultCamelContext.java:1579)
 
	at org.apache.camel.support.ServiceSupport.start(ServiceSupport.java:61)
 
	at org.apache.camel.impl.DefaultCamelContext.start(DefaultCamelContext.java:1547)
 
	at org.apache.camel.blueprint.BlueprintCamelContext.start(BlueprintCamelContext.java:177)
 
	at org.apache.camel.test.blueprint.CamelBlueprintTestSupport.setUp(CamelBlueprintTestSupport.java:137)
 
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)

	at org.junit.runners.model.FrameworkMethod.invokeExplosively(FrameworkMethod.java:44)
 
	at org.junit.internal.runners.statements.RunBefores.evaluate(RunBefores.java:24)

	at org.junit.rules.TestWatcher$1.evaluate(TestWatcher.java:55)
 
	at org.junit.rules.RunRules.evaluate(RunRules.java:20)

item.summary: "NoSuchComponentException: No component with id 'blueprintBundle' could be found"

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: This bug could be related to ARIES-961.

Changing the property placeholder config to use update-strategy="none" seems to avoid the problem or at least make it more difficult to reproduce. 

<cm:property-placeholder persistent-id="org.apache.camel.test.blueprint-properties-test" update-strategy="reload" >
 
        <cm:default-properties>
 
            <cm:property name="variable1" value="value1" />
 
            <cm:property name="variable2" value="value2" />
 
        </cm:default-properties>
 
    </cm:property-placeholder>
This ticket is most likely a duplicate of ENTESB-1466.
verification blocked by ENTESB-3433
After updating pom.xml with version of camel (2.15.1.redhat-620129) and activeq (5.11.0) with unit test attached to this issue, the same errror is still thrown.
With version 2.15.1.redhat-620133 of camel the error is still thrown.

OK, I gave it another try.
If you omit config admin (use update-strategy="none"), than:

for n in `seq 100`; do
 
    echo $n
 
    rm -rf target
 
    mvn test | tee $n.log
 
    if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
 
        break
 
    fi
 
done

run exactly 100 times with BUILD SUCCESS (I had to add some synchronization code to camel-test-blueprint - I'll publish it soon).
ConfigAdmin makes things work worse - I'll try to synchronize that too.

Finally fixed with this merge commit in jboss-fuse/camel 2.15.0.redhat-6-2-x-patch branch for Fuse 6.2.1.

There's is corresponding set of fixes to community Camel version 2.16.

Generally I've added better synchronization code between Blueprint Containers and running CamelBlueprintTestSupport based test cases.

Also update of blueprint-core-1.4.4 helped with one race condition.
